result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
COURT TO USE THE $1000 CASH BAIL ALREADY ON DEPOSIT; DEFENDANT NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $500.00.

NEW CONDITIONS ORDERED ON 10/17/2022: Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services for 90 days or following program protocol for those that are low risk, unless otherwise ordered by the court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring. 

PREVIOUSLY ISSUED CONDITIONS:Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM drug testing. The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day.

9:55 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant William Anthony Von Rueden in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for William Anthony Von Rueden.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Lutgen notes the matter is before the court to address WCS non-compliance and presents some statements with respect to the non-compliance.  State is asking the bail be increased and presents statements.  Atty. Lutgen presents additional statements. For reasons placed on the record the Court will order cash bail be increased to $1500.00; defendant will need to post an additional $500.00.  Court will also order that the defendant be placed on SCRAM monitoring, if not already, through WCS, and all other conditions to remain as previously set.  Court will maintain the previously scheduled further proceedings hearing set for 11/09/2022 at 9:30 AM.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10/5/22 received and filed.
Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:06 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant William Anthony Von Rueden in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for William Anthony Von Rueden.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes the matter is set for status and also to address WCS non-compliance.  Atty. Lutgen provides an update with respect to the case; he is still waiting on an offer from the State so he will be asking for another further proceedings date.  State advises there is an offer in the file and will provide it to Atty. Lutgen.

Court reviews the WCS non-compliance report.  Defendant presents statements.  Court questions the defendant; responses made.  Court admonishes the defendant and reminds him he must comply with all conditions of his bond.  Court will take no further action with respect to bail; bail to remain as previously set at this time.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings in about 30 days.  Court also reminds the defendant he is to report to WCS after court today to be tested.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
